WorkItem.Description:
The optimizer must think that gems grow on trees.  It tells me to remove replace an orange gem with a red gem and then place the exact same orange gem in an empty slot.
 
At the moment I would be happy if the optimizer left my current gemmings alone and simply made recommendations for my empty slots.  Manually (ugh) placing blue dots in front of each gemmed item helps a little, but the optimizer persists in regemming my rep ring, my shoulders, and my belt.
 
Yes, I unchecked the box that says override regemming.

Comments.Message: No, there is no flag where we can say 'only fill empty gem slots' It's all or nothing. And if it's recommending an orange in one and/or moving it to another spot it sounds like its trying to fulfill a Socket Bonus.

I have had cases when optimizing that I only need 1/2 of my gemming to get some stat up to a cap, in which case it will randomly choose which sockets to use each time I optimize.  This does become a little bit of a pain, especially when it randomly chooses between using mixed-color gems and solid-color gems each time, too.  However, the way I use it, it's not enough of a pain to request a new feature myself.

I understand his frustration.
The regemming process could be designed to have the same effect and easier on the gold.

There was a suggestion some time back that the cost function could be used to help with this. ie: we setup a cost for swapping a gem and the optimiser would use that. So it would have as an additional constraint to keep the cost of swapping gems down.

We already have a system in place to minimize gem swaps. If you have a specific example of where improvements could be made please attach a character xml and possibly a screenshot of post-optimizer screen with suggested changes.
